topics.body:
Random post:
Do you ever have one of those moments where you just think about yourself and find it interesting that our identity of self comes from social constructs instructing individuals how to identify yourself?

What I mean by this is that the difference between humans and animals is that we learn how to identify ourselves.  For example the difference between a "normal" person and a feral person is that feral people never learned how to identify themselves or anything and therefore behave on base instincts whereas feral people who are introduced into society slowly become normal individuals through education and such.

It's kind of fascinating when you think about it because "I" as in myself am a socially constructed type of thought whose purpose is to identify what is my self and build upon it to form a identity based upon perceived memories and so forth that may or may not have happened in actuality.  Furthermore "we" can't even prove that sapience is actually a physical thing, but yet here we are thoughts that are initially learned through social constructs identifying ourselves building off how our thoughts view our thoughts expanding upon it to observe the outside world beyond our mere thoughts so as to interact with the outside world and further experience things that ultimately effect how we identify ourselves and in turn changing who we are.

Tl:dr; "I think therefore I am"
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/548940ed6368722e466e0200#post_548940ed6368722e466e0200
[bq="SquiggyBomb"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/548940a7636872189a350000#post_548940a7636872189a350000
You just put into words the major theme of the Ghost in the Shell movie.[/bq]
I have a feeling that when we eventually reach the point where we can copy memories and transport "ghosts" I'm going to accidentally just fucking wreck society.

Salesman, "Try this remote body; just hook up your memories to it and give it a spin"
"Okay"
*pop*
Remote body, "I think therefore I am"
"WHAT?! You copied your 'ghost'?  That shouldn't be physically possible"
"Well at least this'll make getting those game achievements easier with more people"
"Well at least this'll make getting those game achievements easier with more people"
*pop*
"I think therefore I am!"
Salesman, "Oh god!  More?!  What's happening?!"
*pop*
*pop*
*pop*
*pop*
*pop*
*pop*

"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5489416d6368726d0a680200#post_5489416d6368726d0a680200
[bq="mariomarc"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/548940a7636872189a350000#post_548940a7636872189a350000
um

i'll be honest i didn't understand a word of that[/bq]
Tl:dr; your "self" is a idea you have in your head about what yourself consists of.

Isn't solipsism the thing where it's based on the idea of "the only thing I can prove to be true is myself"?

I'm more of a "the only things that actually exist in this universe are matter, energy, matter-energy pairs and so forth" kind of person.
